data.picked: According to the Talmud, the Sukka can be raised higher than the standard height of 20 amah (cubits) if it is used for laundry or other necessary purposes. (Talmud, Succa 22b)

prompt.content: You should answer correct and simple answer, only from real knowledge based on 'suka' part of the Talmud, in Hebrew, as simple as possible. Each question will be about the context of the Talmud himself.
סוכה שהיא גבוהה למעלה מעשרים אמה לפי מי כשרה?

data.sampled: According to the Talmud, the Sukka can be raised higher than the standard height of 20 amah (cubits) if it is used for laundry or other necessary purposes. (Talmud, Succa 22b)

data.picked:
According to the Talmud, the job of packing and arranging the lulav and esrog for Sukkot is actually a biblical commandment, not a rabbinic one.
In the Talmud (Ruth 3a), it is stated: "Rabbi Yochanan said: 'The mitzvah of the lulav and esrog is a biblical commandment, as it is written: "And on the first day of Sukkot, you shall take the fruit of beautiful trees, branching out from the bosom of the field" (Leviticus 23:40).'"
So, the correct answer is: According to the Talmud, the job of packing and arranging the lulav and esrog for Sukkot is actually a biblical commandment, and not a rabbinic one.
